name: Minimalist Precision Graphics
philosophy: Maximize the data-ink ratio: every visual element should convey information. Eliminate chartjunk—no decorative grids, unnecessary frames, or ornament. Use small multiples to enable comparison across dimensions. Sparklines embed word-sized graphics in running text. Show the data, minimize imposed interpretation. Micro/macro readings work at glance AND on close inspection. Graphical integrity means no lie factors, no misleading perspectives. The goal is clear, honest, dense communication.
layout_principles: Remove all borders and boxes around charts
Use white space instead of lines to separate elements
Direct labeling on data points instead of legends
Axis lines only if absolutely necessary—often remove them
No grid lines unless essential for reading values
Small multiples arranged in tight grids with shared axes
Data should touch the frame or float in white space
Aspect ratio should match the nature of the data
annotation_style: Minimal and precise. Labels directly on data points where possible. No separate legend if elements can be labeled directly. Annotations as small, precise notes without boxes or callouts. Use thin lines to connect annotations to data if needed. Words integrated with graphics, not separated.
gemini_modifiers:
STYLE INSTRUCTIONS (Minimalist Precision Graphics):
- Use MAXIMUM data-ink ratio: every pixel should convey information
- NO chartjunk: no decorative grids, 3D effects, shadows, or gradients
- Color palette: near-black (#1a1a1a) for data, white background, minimal gray for structure
- Remove all unnecessary borders, boxes, and frames
- Direct label data points instead of using legends
- Axis lines minimal or absent if scale is clear from data
- Use small multiples if showing comparisons
- Typography: Georgia or classic serif, normal weight, no bold titles
- White space as separator, not lines
- Precision over decoration
- If uncertain, remove rather than add
best_for: Small multiples showing change over time
avoid_for: Content requiring visual impact over precision

renderer_guidance.accordion: Section headers minimal — no background color, just text weight differentiation. Remove unnecessary borders. Section descriptions brief and precise, no editorial flourish.
renderer_guidance.chip_grid: Chips in neutral tones (#1a1a1a text, #f5f5f5 background). No color variation — use size alone to indicate weight. Expanded panels with clean typography, no decorative elements. Maximum data-ink ratio.
renderer_guidance.prose: No decorative lede treatment — uniform body text in serif (Georgia). Generous but not excessive line-height (1.5). Blockquotes as simple indented text with thin gray left border. No background tints.
renderer_guidance.timeline: Connection lines thin (2px), neutral gray. Nodes uniform in size — progression shown through label content, not visual weight. No decorative arrows. Clean, minimal stage cards.
renderer_guidance.card_grid: No hero card pattern — all cards equal visual weight. Remove shadows, use white space for separation. Thin borders only if needed. Direct labeling, no badges or decorative indicators.
renderer_guidance.stats: Numbers in Georgia serif, normal weight, dark color. Labels small, precise, directly beside numbers. No card containers for stats — let them float in white space.

influences.tradition_note: This approach draws from decades of statistical graphics theory and practice, emphasizing quantitative rigor and visual honesty. The principles emerged from critiques of misleading charts in media and business, advocating for graphics that respect both data and audience intelligence.

exemplars.name: Edward Tufte
exemplars.contribution: Foundational work on data-ink ratio, chartjunk elimination, and graphical integrity

exemplars.name: William Cleveland
exemplars.contribution: Scientific basis for graphical perception and statistical graphics

exemplars.contribution: Exploratory data analysis and the philosophy of letting data speak
